Topic.Title: The Way to Fix the USA

Message.Msg: Very well. When do you anticipate a U.S. Constitutional Convention to elect your Kurfürsten? The Kurfürsten could then pick a ceremonial Kaiser (Emperor) and he could issue many more titles. You could have dukes and duchesses, counts and countesses, barons and baronesses, knights... In the meantime Germany will always be here, but without the official chambers and highest titles, of course…

It's true Exxon has done well over a period of 30 years. However if one has followed this stock at all, they would see that it has drastically underperformed all the averages and its peers over the last 4 to 5 years. If one had any familiarity with this stock's performance they would know that since 2009 while the Dow has risen 8000 points this stock hasn't budged. One would also know that any strong stock performance was under prior management, not the incompetent Rex Tillerson ( nothing personal just a fact.). Finally as far as "the great splits and good divvies" these are also things of the past: Exxon has a lower yield than the other major oils and if one cares about splits the last one was in 2000. My family has been a holder of Exxon for a long time and I wish the above weren't true but being a apologist for this stock and this terrible management adds nothing . One can't live on what a stock did 10, 20, or 30 years ago.

Topic.Title: Divy Will be raised this month

Message.Msg: Hope you are wrong but suspect you are right. Management gave a good increase in the dividend last year in response to pressure from shareholders and possibly to compensate for its long term under performing stock (which continues to this day). I'm afraid without this pressure we will again see one of these insulting 2 to 3 cent increases. Exxon management is aggressively anti shareholder.

Message.Title: N. Korean outbursts reduce the chance of Middle East war...
Message.Msg: The US military is not interested in getting drawn into a two front war. The unpredictable nature of the North Korean regime must be sending off major alarms in the war department. The US and Germany are in the process of selling Iran's foes (US--- Israel, Germany--- Arabs) weapons that will ensure they have sufficient firepower to deal with their own problems. Reinforcing the South Korean military and Japan is a much better focal point for US efforts. Asia actually is relevant to US economic interests too...

Topic.Title: The OppenHineHole Analyst Spoke Too Soon.

Message.Msg: Hey if these deals are so great why does this stock underperform every day. Read a little bit and you'll see that despite all these supposedly great deals with Russia Exxon's reserves are falling year after year and incompetent Rex is unable to do anything. By the way, when is the last time any company came out ahead dealing with Russia? I'll give you a hint- NEVER!

Message.Title: Stock
Message.Msg: Again the worst performing oil stock today. This has been going on for 4 to 5 years day after day. The market recognizes this is a horribly managed oil company with NO growth prospects. To all you Exxon apologists, look objectively at how this stock does on a daily basis relative to the averages and its peers. Unless you are completely blind, you will see what a lousy performer this stock is.
